pages.text: QuÃ©bec.AI AcademyQUÃ‰BEC.AI ACADEMY: ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE 101 Artificial Intelligence 101: World-Class Overview of AI for AllA Well-Crafted Actionable 75 Minutes Tutorial. For the purpose of entrusting all sentient beings with powerful AI tools to learn, deploy and scale AI in order to enhance their prosperity, to settle planetary-scale problems and to inspire those who, with AI, will shape the 21st Century, MontrÃ©al.AI introduces the â€œVIP AI 101 CheatSheet for Allâ€. VIP AI 101 CheatSheet for Allhttp://www.montreal.ai/ai4all.pdf Encompassing all facets of AI, the General Secretariat of MONTREAL.AI presents, with authority and from insider knowledge: â€œArtificial Intelligence 101: The First World-Class Overview of AI for the General Publicâ€œ. POWERFUL & USEFUL. This actionable tutorial is designed to entrust everybody with the mindset, the skills and the tools to see artificial intelligence from an empowering new vantage point by : â€” Exalting state of the art discoveries and science ;â€” Curating the best open-source codes & implementations ; andâ€” Embodying the impetus that drives todayâ€™s artificial intelligence. You are qualified for a career in machine learning! Andrew NgI want to pursue machine learning as a career but not sure if I am qualified... Program: http://montreal.ai/academy.pdf Powered by Eventbrite Language: Course given in English. Location: NRH Prince Arthur - Ballroom B, 3625 Avenue du Parc, Montreal (QuÃ©bec), Canada, H2X 3P8. â€œIn life, you need forcing functions. You never know what youâ€™re capable of until you have no choice but go and do it. Excessive comfort leads to unrealized potential.â€œ â€” FranÃ§ois Chollet Curated Open-Source Codes, Implementations and ScienceMontrÃ©al.AI is the largest artificial intelligence community in Canada. Join us and learn at https://www.facebook.com/groups/MontrealAI/ ! â€œThe best way to predict the future is to invent it.â€œ â€” Alan Kay 0. Getting StartedTodayâ€™s artificial intelligence is powerful, useful and accessible to all. Tinker with Neural Networks : Neural Network Playground â€” TensorFlow On a Local MachineInstall Anaconda and Launch â€˜Anaconda Navigatorâ€™Update Jupyterlab and Launch the Application Under Notebook, Click on â€˜Python 3â€™ JupyterLab is Ready for Users â€” Project Jupyter In the Cloud Colab: An easy way to learn and use TensorFlow â€” TensorFlow Access free GPU compute via Colab â€” TensorFlow Open in Colab â€” Open a Github-hosted notebook in Google Colab â€” colab-team TensorFlow Blog â€” TensorFlow In the Browser TensorFlow dev summit Official TensorFlow.js Launch Introducing TensorFlow.js: Machine Learning in Javascript â€” Josh Gordon, Sara Robinson TensorFlow.js â€” TensorFlow Preliminary Readings Deep Learning â€” Yann LeCun, Yoshua Bengio, Geoffrey Hinton The WIRED Guide to artificial intelligence â€” WIRED How to teach yourself hard things â€” Julia Evans Learn X in Y minutes (Where X=python3) â€” Louie Dinh The Matrix Calculus You Need For Deep Learning â€” Terence Parr, Jeremy Howard Introduction to the math of backprop â€” Deb Panigrahi Introduction to Applied Linear Algebra â€“ Vectors, Matrices, and Least Squares â€” Stephen Boyd and Lieven Vandenberghe, Cambridge University Press â€œA birds-eye view of optimization algorithmsâ€ â€” Fabian Pedregosa Dive into Deep Learning â€” Aston Zhang, Zack C. Lipton, Mu Li, Alex J. Smola How to visualize decision trees â€” Terence Parr, Prince Grover Machine Learning for Visualization â€” Ian Johnson Scipy Lecture Notes â€” Scipy Interview with The Youngest Kaggle Grandmaster: Mikel Bober-Irizar (anokas) â€” Sanyam Bhutani, Hacker Noon Cutting-Edge Face Recognition is Complicated. These Spreadsheets Make it Easier. â€” Dave Smith Competitive Programmerâ€™s Handbook â€” Antti Laaksonen Machine Learning from scratch! â€” Quan Tran Rules of Machine Learning: Best Practices for ML Engineering â€” Martin Zinkevich A Neural Network in 11 lines of Python â€” iamtrask Bias-Variance Decomposition â€” Sebastian Raschka SpaceSheet: Interactive Latent Space Exploration through a Spreadsheet Interface Paper | Demo | Tool â€” Bryan Loh, Tom White On intelligence: its creation and understanding â€” Surya Ganguli Introduction to Artificial Intelligence, ULiÃ¨ge, Fall 2018. â€” Gilles Louppe Deep Learning cheatsheets for Stanfordâ€™s CS 230 â€” Afshine Amidi, Shervine Amidi Machine Learning From Scratch â€” Erik Linder-NorÃ©n A Beginnerâ€™s Guide to the Mathematics of Neural Networks â€” A.C.C. Coolen 1. Deep Learning â€œDL is essentially a new style of programmingâ€“â€differentiable programmingâ€â€“and the field is trying to work out the reusable constructs in this style. We have some: convolution, pooling, LSTM, GAN, VAE, memory units, routing units, etc.â€œ â€” Thomas G. Dietterich 1.1 Neural Networks â€œNeural networksâ€ are a sad misnomer. Theyâ€™re neither neural nor even networks. Theyâ€™re chains of differentiable, parameterized geometric functions, trained with gradient descent (with gradients obtained via the chain rule). A small set of highschool-level ideas put together.â€œ â€” FranÃ§ois Chollet AI Playbook â€” Andreessen Horowitz Clear Explanations of Machine Learning â€” Distill Deep Learning Book â€” Ian Goodfellow, Yoshua Bengio, Aaron Courville Neural Networks and Deep Learning â€” Michael Nielsen Deep Learning â€” Vincent Vanhoucke | Google TensorSpace: Neural network 3D visualization framework â€”TensorSpace A Complete Implementation of a Toy Neural Network â€” Stanford CS class CS231n Neural networks: training with backpropagation â€” Jeremy Jordan Introduction to Machine Learning for Coders â€” Jeremy Howard Machine Learning Yearning â€” Andrew Ng Effective TensorFlow for Non-Experts â€” Google Developers A curated collection of inspirational AI-powered JavaScript apps â€” Elle Haproff, Asim Hussain, Osama Jandali Pytorch Implementation of Neural Processes â€” Chris Ormandy A Few Unusual Autoencoders â€” Colin Raffel Pytorch implementation of JointVAE, a framework for disentangling continuous and discrete factors of variation â€” Schlumberger Software Technology A New TensorFlow Hub Web Experience â€” AndrÃ© Susano Pinto, Clemens Mewald Approximate Fisher Information Matrix to Characterise the Training of Deep Neural Networks â€” Zhibin Liao, Tom Drummond, Ian Reid, Gustavo Carneiro Building Web App for Computer Vision Model & Deploying to Production in 10 Minutes*: A Detailed Guide â€” Pankaj Mathur Measuring the Effects of Data Parallelism on Neural Network Training â€” Christopher J. Shallue, Jaehoon Lee, Joe Antognini, Jascha Sohl-Dickstein, Roy Frostig, George E. Dahl Avito Demand Prediction Challenge : Kaggle winner explains how to combine categorical, numerical, image and text features into a single NN that gets you into top 10 without stacking â€” Little Boat fast.ai | Making neural nets uncool again Intro Machine Learning | Practical Deep Learning | Cutting Edge Deep Learning | Computational Linear Algebra â€” Jeremy Howard, Rachel Thomas | Fast.AI â€œI feel like a significant percentage of Deep Learning breakthroughs ask the question â€œhow can I reuse weights in multiple places?â€â€“ Recurrent (LSTM) layers reuse for multiple timestepsâ€“ Convolutional layers reuse in multiple locations.â€“ Capsules reuse across orientation.â€œ â€” Trask 1.2 Recurrent Neural Networks Understanding LSTM Networks â€” Christopher Olah Attention and Augmented RNN â€” Olah & Carter, 2016 Computer, respond to this email â€” Post by Greg Corrado Reversible Recurrent Neural Networks â€” Matthew MacKay, Paul Vicol, Jimmy Ba, Roger Grosse Recurrent Relational Networks Blog | arXiv | Code â€” Rasmus Berg Palm, Ulrich Paquet, Ole Winther Massive Exploration of Neural Machine Translation Architectures arXiv | Docs | Code â€” Denny Britz, Anna Goldie, Minh-Thang Luong, Quoc Le A TensorFlow implementation of : â€œHybrid computing using a neural network with dynamic external memoryâ€ GitHub â€” Alex Graves, Greg Wayne, Malcolm Reynolds, Tim Harley, Ivo Danihelka, Agnieszka Grabska-BarwiÅ„ska, Sergio GÃ³mez Colmenarejo, Edward Grefenstette, Tiago Ramalho, John Agapiou, AdriÃ  PuigdomÃ¨nech Badia, Karl Moritz Hermann, Yori Zwols, Georg Ostrovski, Adam Cain, Helen King, Christopher Summerfield, Phil Blunsom, Koray Kavukcuoglu & Demis Hassabis 1.3 Convolution Neural Network â€œI admire the elegance of your method of computation; it must be nice to ride through these fields upon the horse of true mathematics while the like of us have to make our way laboriously on foot.â€œ â€” A. pages.title: QUÃ‰BEC.AI | QuÃ©bec Artificial Intelligence
pages.text: QuÃ©bec.AI Web â€” The Dawn of Artificial IntelligenceArtificial Intelligence for the Web : Converting AI Research into Commercial Successes. At the forefront of AI, deploying superhuman agents that can learn from experience in the browser unlocks new powerful possibilities to apply AI in ways we never thought of! E.g., on a mobile device, the autonomous agent can leverage sensor data (i.e.: gyroscope or accelerometer) and take actions. True understanding comes from agents that learn by â€œseeingâ€ how they affect the world. All data stays on the client, making AI agents in the browser useful for privacy preserving applications. â€œ Artificial Intelligence is about recognising patterns, Artificial Life is about creating patterns. â€œ â€” Mizuki Oka et al, #alife2018 A Proof of Concept : Getting Alexa to Respond to Sign LanguageUsing TensorFlow to make an Amazon Echo respond to sign language, by M. A. Singh : Blog Post by by M. A. Singh Code for the Proof of Concept on GitHub Advanced and Impactful Open-Source TechnologiesBringing contributions by scholars recognized as the foremost authorities in their fields, QuÃ©bec Artificial Intelligence is ahead of trends that will profoundly influence the future of Humanity. Cutting edge open-source technologies proudly used : 1. TensorFlow.jsTraining and Deploying ML Models in the Browser TensorFlow.js uses flexible and intuitive APIs to build and train models from scratch using a low-level JavaScript linear algebra library or a high-level layers API. The TensorFlow.js model converters allows running pre-existing TensorFlow models right in the browser or under Node.js. Pre-existing ML models can be retrained using sensor data connected to the browser, or other client-side data. Three development workflows : Importing an existing, pre-trained model for inference ; Re-training an imported model quickly (transfer learning) with only a small amount of data ; and Authoring (define, train, and run) models directly in the browser. TensorFlow.js AI agents can be trained using reinforcement learning, neuroevolution, or other machine learning methods. Thereâ€™s no need to install anything. Just open a webpage, and your AI Agent is ready to run. References : TensorFlow.js TensorFlow dev summit Official TensorFlow.js Launch Introducing TensorFlow.js by Josh Gordon and Sara Robinson Deep Learning in JS - Ashi Krishnan - JSConf EU 2018 TensorFlow.js Gallery 2. Reinforcement LearningGoing Beyond Input-Output Pattern Recognition In the past few years deep reinforcement learning started achieving state-of-the-art results. â€œ Reinforcement learning (RL) is the subfield of machine learning concerned with decision making and motor control. It studies how an agent can learn how to achieve goals in a complex, uncertain environment. â€œ â€” OpenAI At the bleeding edge of AI, autonomous agents can learn from experience, simulate worlds and orchestrate meta-solutions. Hereâ€™s an inspiring example of a high-quality implementation of a reinforcement learning algorithm : Powerful and useful application domains : Dialogue, Healthcare, Management, Robotics, Smart Grid, Supply Chains, etc. â€œ Self-Play is Automated Knowledge Creation. â€œ â€” Carlos E. Perez References : OpenAI Gym by OpenAI OpenAI Baselines by OpenAI AlphaGo Zero: Learning from scratch by DeepMind A Visual Guide to Evolution Strategies by David Ha OpenAI Five by OpenAI 3. TensorFlow HubReusing Machine Learning Modules TensorFlow Hub is a library for the publication, discovery, and consumption of reusable parts of machine learning models. A module is a self-contained piece of a TensorFlow graph, along with its weights and assets, that can be reused across different tasks in a process known as transfer learning. Transfer learning can: Train a model with a smaller dataset ; Improve generalization: and Speed up training. â€œ I think transfer learning is the key to general intelligence. And I think the key to doing transfer learning will be the acquisition of conceptual knowledge that is abstracted away from perceptual details of where you learned it from. â€œ â€” Demis Hassabis TensorFlow Hub Introducing TensorFlow Hub by Josh Gordon Transform your Web Site with an AI AgentFully-fledged AI systems can achieve serious revenue! QuÃ©bec Artificial Intelligence helps to transform Web sites for the age of artificial intelligence by developing machine learning agents in the browser that achieves goal-oriented behavior. Demos : Solving the cart-pole control problem in the browser using the policy-gradient method Live demo : https://storage.googleapis.com/tfjs-examples/cart-pole/dist/index.html Code : https://github.com/tensorflow/tfjs-examples/tree/master/cart-pole Predicting balls and strikes using TensorFlow.js Blog : https://medium.com/tensorflow/predicting-balls-and-strikes-using-tensorflow-js-2acf1d7a447c Animation with CPPNs and TensorFlow.js, an @observablehq notebook by Emily Reif @observablehq notebook by Emily Reif : https://beta.observablehq.com/@emilyreif/animation-with-cppns Move Mirror: An AI Experiment with Pose Estimation in the Browser using TensorFlow.js By Jane Friedhoff and Irene Alvarado : https://medium.com/tensorflow/move-mirror-an-ai-experiment-with-pose-estimation-in-the-browser-using-tensorflow-js-2f7b769f9b23 L1: Tensor Studio â€” An in-browser live-programming environment by Milan LajtoÅ¡ Live demo : https://mlajtos.github.io/L1/latest/ Github : https://github.com/mlajtos/L1 References : Unity ML-Agents Toolkit by Unity A Brief Survey of Deep Reinforcement Learning Arulkumaran et al. â€œ Nothing is more powerful than an idea whose time has come. â€œ â€” Victor Hugo QuÃ©bec.AI is offering a new world age of impactful technical prowesses on an unprecedented scale. Web | Paper â€” Minsuk Kahng, Nikhil Thorat, Polo Chau, Fernanda ViÃ©gas, and Martin Wattenberg Generating Memoji from Photos â€” Pat Niemeyer Playing a game of GANstruction â€” Helena Sarin Large Scale GAN Training for High Fidelity Natural Image Synthesis Paper | TF Hub | Colab â€” Andrew Brock, Jeff Donahue, Karen Simonyan TL-GAN: transparent latent-space GAN â€” SummitKwan TensorFlow-GAN (TFGAN) â€” Joel Shor, Sergio Guadarrama Progressive GANs | Notebook with smooth interpolations through z-space â€” Gene Kogan Self-Attention GAN Paper | Tensorflow implementation â€” Han Zhang, Ian Goodfellow, Dimitris Metaxas, Augustus Odena Discriminator Rejection Sampling â€” Samaneh Azadi, Catherine Olsson, Trevor Darrell, Ian Goodfellow, Augustus Odena Tensorpack | Generative Adversarial Networks â€” Tensorpack Ngx | Neural network based visual generator and mixer â€” Keijiro Takahashi Magenta Studio (beta) â€” Google AI Differentiable Monte Carlo Ray Tracing through Edge Sampling â€” Tzu-Mao Li, Miika Aittala, FrÃ©do Durand, Jaakko Lehtinen A Few Unusual Autoencoders â€” Colin Raffel Deep Variational Reinforcement Learning for POMDPs â€” Maximilian Igl, Luisa Zintgraf, Tuan Anh Le, Frank Wood, Shimon Whiteson Learning Dexterity â€” OpenAI Robots that Learn â€” OpenAI (Self-Play) | OpenAI Five â€” OpenAI TFHub state-of-the-art AutoAugment Modules â€” TensorFlow Creatability: a new collection of experiments exploring ways to make creative tools more accessible â€” Experiments with Google Evolved Virtual Creatures, Evolution Simulation, 1994 â€” Karl Sims Reinforcement Learning for Improving Agent Design: What happens when we let an agent learn a better body design together with learning its task?
